page.title: 11VILLAGE CONCERNS
page.content: The Parish Councils make decisions on the local minor matters at their monthly meetings (following national guidelines). Only one or two members of the public turn up to these although the Annual Parish Meeting in West Wratting is very well attended (30-40 people out of a population of 400) when a member of all the clubs in the community make a report. There are topics which cause concern to the villagers and re-appear every few years:- lack of street lighting (too expensive); bus shelters; the state of the roads; stubble burning; closure of the Pubs due to lack of use (the one in Weston Green The Fox and Hounds this year,the one in West Wickham The White Horse a few years ago but it has just re-opened, the one in West Wratting soon). The rest are long gone.
